The iron work radiates beauty. The kitchen has a soundproof ceiling!!!! I found a 100 year old Sears and Roebuck Catalog Book! We looked and admired the photos from when the home was built. You can see the proudness in the families eye's and what a lovely family. The sliding doors to the outside are smooth and quiet. The backyard is absolutely stunning! Just sit and watch. You have your own live nature show! Hummingbirds, woodpeckers, deer! The host, Ms. Janice, made sure my family was comfortable. She stayed in contact with me. She even phoned to make sure my elderly father in law was doing ok within the home. She truly cares. There is also a lower bed for which my father used due to knee surgery, he had no problem getting in and out of bed nor to the restroom. You feel so safe while you are there. We are in love with this home and we will definitely be coming back! Thank you Janice for everything! We really were at home.
XxxOoo

On a stifling Louisiana day the house was enticingly cool with AC and ceiling fans running. As I moved through the house lamps provided a dimly lit path revealing a collection of vintage treasures and the overhead light switches. It was apparent I was both expected and being invited in.
As a lone traveller I felt safe in Killgore cottage and in the residential neighborhood I temporarily joined.
I found it ideally situated for my purpose and during the hottest part of the August days a welcoming retreat.
From condiments to soaps and cleaning supplies so many extras were provided.
I left Haynesville contentedly knowing I have a cozy Louisiana home to return to on my next visit.
Beverlee and Keith are amazing hosts; they’re friendly and welcoming, very responsive to communication and considerate of guest privacy.

Basically everyone is friendly and will wave at you as you sit on the porch, walk around town, or talk to you if you run into them at the Piggly Wiggly. There are a handful of restaurants in town one can support. The downtown area has great potential. I personally feel that if the town had a few festivals during the year, perhaps a farmers market (not sure if I missed one), got the downtown spiced up with perhaps local artists, farmers, beekeepers, lemonade stands..whatever the peoples talents are, this town could be even more amazing.
